DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more sponsor-defined characters used to identify, name, or characterize the protocol deviations._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

PermissibleValues.value: Baseline assessments are out of window
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Baseline Assessments Are Out of Window

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Baseline Assessments Are Out of Window
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a subject's baseline assessments did not occur within the time window required by the study protocol.

Concepts.longName: Baseline Assessments Are Out of Window
Concepts.definition: An indication that a subject's baseline assessments did not occur within the time window required by the study protocol.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient does not have a safety follow up as required
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient Did Not Have a Safety Follow Up as Required

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient Did Not Have a Safety Follow Up as Required
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a subject's safely follow up did not occur as required by the study protocol.

Concepts.longName: Patient Did Not Have a Safety Follow Up as Required
Concepts.definition: An indication that a subject's safely follow up did not occur as required by the study protocol.

PermissibleValues.value: Failure to report SAE within defined timeframe
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Failure to Report Serious Adverse Event within Defined Timeframe

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Failure to Report Serious Adverse Event within Defined Timeframe
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a protocol deviation was due to a failure to report a serious adverse event within the timeframe established in the study protocol.

Concepts.longName: Failure to Report Serious Adverse Event within Defined Timeframe
Concepts.definition: An indication that a protocol deviation was due to a failure to report a serious adverse event within the timeframe established in the study protocol.

PermissibleValues.value: Con med used was not permitted per protocol
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Concomitant Medication Used was not Permitted per Protocol

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Used was not Permitted per Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a concomitant agent was administered but this agent was not permitted by the protocol.

Concepts.longName: Concomitant Medication Used was not Permitted per Protocol
Concepts.definition: An indication that a concomitant agent was administered but this agent was not permitted by the protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a subject's treatment was not discontinued as per the protocol.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a subject's treatment was not discontinued as per the protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the trial randomization processes or procedures defined in the study protocol were not followed.

Concepts.definition: An indication that the trial randomization processes or procedures defined in the study protocol were not followed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the subject has not fulfilled the criteria needed to continue to the next study period.

Concepts.definition: An indication that the subject has not fulfilled the criteria needed to continue to the next study period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a subject's disease outcome or response is not covered by the study protocol.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a subject's disease outcome or response is not covered by the study protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the informed consent processes or procedures defined the study protocol were not followed.

Concepts.definition: An indication that the informed consent processes or procedures defined the study protocol were not followed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lab, Imaging, or Other Investigation Deviation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lab, Imaging, or Other Investigation Deviation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved a lab test or procedure, an imaging event, or some other investigation.

Concepts.longName: Lab, Imaging, or Other Investigation Deviation
Concepts.definition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved a lab test or procedure, an imaging event, or some other investigation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved a study agent.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved a study agent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved a study device.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved a study device.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved the trial processes or procedures defined in the study protocol.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a protocol deviation involved the trial processes or procedures defined in the study protocol.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the deviation category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DVCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the category of the protocol deviation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the protocol deviation category?
